comment: Professor Elsey is a great person, but uncoordinated. I had her for ART4490, and although this was a new class, it was packed with projects and information. She is very nice and understanding of students' schedules, but she requires a lot of assignments throughout the entire semester. Due dates are unorganized, it's a lot of work, but she's sweet.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Elsey is a wonderful professor. She's very understanding with absences and working with your schedule. You need time management and being attentive to lectures for the weekly assignments and tests. The projects are somewhat manageable, just don't procasinate to the last minute. I enjoyed having independent work, graded fairly quick.

Professor Elsey is a wonderful professor, even if the class itself is a bit difficult. 5 projects, 2 tests, and the weekly short worksheets and check-ins. Fast at grading, and clear on what is expected. She is very kind and approachable. You WILL need to collect 140+ bottle caps for the last project, so prepare! Put in effort and you will succeed.

So kind but a bit unorganized. She is super approachable and understanding but MAKE SURE YOU DO THE WORKSHEETS AND CHECK INS. The classes are long so it does feel like they drag on a lot. Its hard to catch up if you miss a day so be super proactive.

You only are graded on 4 out of the 12 discussion post she offers, you can do extra credit every week to add another grade, there's one midterm and a final. You also have to do an in-person museum visit to any museum you chose and then write a simple report about it. All and all, simple art class, and I would take it again if I needed to.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Lots of projects and notebook checks. It's not the most difficult course, but do not fall behind on the classwork. Great overall!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Elsey does a great job providing resources and demos to understand 3D media. She is really charismatic and understanding and will help you in class if you need it. There are very involved weekly assignments and pretty heavy projects. It can be a lot if you get behind or are disorganized, but you'll definitely learn something new!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Elsey is amazing! You can voice your questions and concerns to her as many times as you need without feeling dumb. She is willing to work with you until you understand how to do something, so don't ever be afraid to reach out to her! It is a project heavy class, but it is manageable as long as you keep up with the assigned work.

She is very cool and it feels relaxed, but there is an insane amount of homework worksheets and check ins, so if you don't want that large of a workload she may not be the right choice. That said, she was very cool and understanding, as well as willing to work with your ideas and issues.

Professor Elsey is a great professor. I took her for both 2D and 3D design. She is very understanding, and encourages creativity. The only thing I would say is: STAY ON TOP OF YOUR PROJECTS, WORKSHEETS & CHECK-INS & MAKE SURE YOU GET ALL OF YOUR MATERIALS FOR EACH PROJECT! Do these things, and pay attention to the lectures and you'll be just fine.

The professor is really nice and open. She patient, gives good help and feedback on your artwork and artist statements. In this class, you'll have 3 projects: wire, cardboard, and plaster (we didn't get do to the mandala project). There are weekly assignments, one research project, and artist statements for each project. Advice: DON'T GET BEHIND!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Prof Elsey is awesome! She has interesting lectures and is very caring and understanding of different situations. Outside of the main projects you will have weekly hw assignments that are about what was covered during the lecture. She uploads the lectures to D2L so you can find them easily. Do the work on time and youll make an A

Highly recommend. She's one of the best instructors I've had in college! She is so caring and understanding. The due dates are always clear and so are her instructions because the announcements on D2L are always up to date. Just do your work and you will get an A.

There are few art projects so make sure each counts. Make sure to go to class to stay updated on what she has planned as D2L doesn't always reflect her schedule right. She's sweet and understanding, and knows how to appreciate artistic visions. If you need help, don't be afraid to ask!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring
